Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Nevada Republicans "didn't do one single thing to cut spending" in 2015, when in fact, there were some spending cuts made.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that Nevada lawmakers passed the largest tax increase in state history in 2015.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that Nevada Republicans did not make any efforts to cut spending.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the sole responsibility of Republicans was to cut spending, without considering other factors or priorities.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by candidate Danny Tarkanian, who argues that Republicans missed an opportunity to substantially restructure spending in certain areas before raising taxes.
